item.title: For Sale sign on pavement, 17th August
item.description:
An estate agent has put up a For Sale sign on the public pavement. This is separate to the flyposter (David Rodigan) on the central reservation. The flyposter has been there for many weeks now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Abandoned barriers and signs on bridge, 17th August
item.description:
Red barriers and "footpath closed" signs have been left on this bridge for over 3 months. No work has ever been carried out. 2 other reports have been closed but nothing has been done. Please remove these barriers and signs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Snapped of branch in middle maple tree, 17th August
item.description:
At end of June, in the high winds, I reported a branch had snapped off one of the large plane trees. Middle one of the 3. I think the branch was held up by the lower canopy. That branch is now dead or dying and probably needs to be removed to avoid falling into road. On image if you pan up from the lady you can see the scar on the upper branch. The second image shows the dead branch still suspended.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69, Pittville Lawn, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of areas of road breaking up, sunken, holes, 17th August
item.description:
The area of Village Road outside the properties of New Dawn housing. There are lots of sections of this road close to the kerb that are uneven, having broken tarmac, holes, uneven edges and sunken areas. It is dangerous to cycle over as vehicles pass there is no way to avoid this area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 105, Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings worn and obscured, 17th August
item.description:
The road markings on this approach to the roundabout have become very worn and unclear, making it difficult to determine which lane to be in or even where the lanes are divided. It is not safe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection (16th August 2025), 16th August
item.description:
Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection. Two bags, one containing general litter and the other cans/plastic bottles for recycling. Next to Innsworth Lane Sports Ground sign. The 'What 3 Words' location is ///examiner.slopes.courage The ordnance survey map reference is: 51.883919,-2.213313 Council Litter Bin Ref: 0254

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
